title: Lou Reed-Street Hassle-12 inch-Vinylrip-Abrasax
description:
Lou Reed-Street Hassel 12" -Vinylrip-320-Abrasax

Vinylrip:
Lou Reed & The Velvet Underground
RELEASED: 1978
LABEL: Arista
FORMAT: 12"
PRODUCER: Lou Reed / Andy Warhole 
BITRATE: 320

A-side:
Lou Reed
01. Street Hassle - Waltzing Matilda/Street Hassle/Slipaway

B-side:
Velvet Underground
02. I'm Waiting For The Man
03. Venus In Furs 

"Street Hassle" is a song recorded by Lou Reed for his album of the same name. The song is 11 minutes long, divided into three distinct sections: Waltzing Matilda, Street Hassle, & Slip Away. Part one, "Waltzing Matilda," describes a woman picking up and paying a male prosititue. In Part Two, "Street Hassle," a drug dealer monologues at length about the death of a woman (ostensibly "Waltzing Matilda") in his apartment to her companion (presumably the male prosititue from Part One). Part Three, "Slip Away," contains a brief spoken word section by Bruce Springsteen (from 9:02 to 9:39) and a dirge sung by Reed about love and death.

The cover is included but I had to scan it in two pieces and put them together in Photoshop. :)
